newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian PM to meet Jospin on Renault.
newsitem.headline: Belgian PM to meet Jospin on Renault.

text.p: Belgian Prime Minister Jean-Luc Dehaene will meet his newly elected French counterpart Lionel Jospin in Paris later on Saturday for talks on Europe and the closure of the Belgian Renault plant, Dehaene's office said.
The meeting is scheduled for 5.30 p.m. (1530 GMT). Details of the agenda were not available.

Dehaene said on Thursday he wanted to discuss Renault's decision to close its Vilvoorde plant with Jospin before June 10. On that day there are meetings of the Renault board and of the carmaker's shareholders who include the French state.
Renault, which announced the closure with 3,100 job losses in February, reiterated on Wednesday it was indispensable to cut costs and streamline its European car assembly operations.
Dehaene, who lives in Vilvoorde, has branded next month's planned closure as "unacceptable."
The Belgian Prime Minister is likely to remind Jospin of an election promise that he would ask Renault to study alternatives to allow the plant to remain open.

Dehaene's visit is part of a campaign to preserve jobs. Louis Tobback, head of the Flemish Socialist Party, has urged Jospin to delay the closure of the assembly plant and start discussions about alternatives.
The French Socialist Party, part of Jospin's government, said on Wednesday it also opposed the closure.
Renault lost 5.25 billion francs ($901.2 million) last year and is struggling to break even this year.

Renault-Vilvoorde workers have said they will halt work ahead of the June 10 meetings. Production at the plant has been patchy since employees voted to end a six-week strike which followed February's news of the closure.
